name: self-hosted-gateway
description: Selfhosted-gateway is a Docker-native tunneling solution that exposes local containers to the public internet via a remote WireGuard gateway. It automates reverse proxy setup with NGINX/Caddy and TLS, ideal for securely publishing homelab services.
features: WireGuard tunneling: Securely exposes local services through encrypted WireGuard VPN tunnels.
Docker integration: Automatically detects and configures containers with simple labels.
Reverse proxy automation: Sets up NGINX or Caddy reverse proxies without manual configuration.
TLS certificates: Automatically provisions and renews Let's Encrypt certificates for HTTPS.
Remote gateway: Connects homelab services to a public VPS for internet accessibility.
Zero-trust networking: Isolates services with network segmentation and access controls.
Dynamic DNS: Updates DNS records automatically when gateway IP addresses change.
Multi-service support: Exposes multiple containers through a single gateway instance.
Health checks: Monitors service availability and routes traffic only to healthy backends.
Traffic logging: Records access logs for security monitoring and troubleshooting.
Bandwidth control: Implements rate limiting to prevent abuse and manage costs.
Failover support: Automatically switches to backup gateways if primary becomes unavailable.
